definitions: quality of being based on personal feelings, opinions, or perspectives rather than objective facts
examples: The subjectivity of art criticism makes consensus difficult
Acknowledging subjectivity helps understand different viewpoints better

definitions: act of bringing someone or something under domination through conquest or oppression
examples: The subjugation of indigenous peoples left lasting historical wounds
Economic subjugation through debt creates modern forms of control

definitions: rental property leased by a tenant to another person while maintaining original lease
examples: The summer sublet helped cover rent during vacation
Finding a reliable sublet requires careful tenant screening

definitions: direct transformation of solid substance into gas without becoming liquid
psychological process of channeling unacceptable impulses into socially acceptable activities
examples: Dry ice undergoes sublimation at room temperature conditions
The sublimation of frozen carbon dioxide creates theatrical fog
His sublimation of aggression into competitive sports proved healthy
Art often represents sublimation of deep psychological conflicts

definitions: naval vessel designed to operate completely submerged beneath water surface
long sandwich made with elongated roll filled with meats and vegetables
examples: The nuclear submarine patrolled beneath Arctic ice sheets
Modern submarines can remain submerged for months continuously
He ordered an Italian submarine with extra peppers
The deli makes the best submarine sandwiches downtown

definitions: state or process of being covered completely by water or another liquid
examples: The submergence of coastal areas threatens island nations
Complete submergence lasted only thirty seconds before surfacing

definitions: act of placing or going below the surface of water or other liquid
examples: Submerging the hot metal caused violent steam eruption
The diver practiced submerging techniques in shallow water

definitions: small vessel designed for underwater operations, research, or exploration at various depths
examples: The research submersible explored deep ocean trenches yesterday
Remote-controlled submersibles inspect underwater pipeline damage regularly

definitions: act or state of being completely covered or plunged into liquid, especially water
examples: Total submersion baptism symbolizes spiritual rebirth powerfully
The submersion test checks electronic device water resistance

definitions: act of presenting document, proposal, or work for consideration or judgment
act of accepting or yielding to superior force, authority, or will
examples: The grant submission deadline expires next Friday afternoon
Her manuscript submission received positive editorial feedback quickly
His submission to authority avoided further workplace conflict
The fighter signaled submission by tapping the mat

definitions: person who holds lower position or rank within organizational hierarchy
examples: The manager met with subordinates to discuss quarterly goals
Treating subordinates respectfully improves workplace morale significantly

definitions: state or act of placing in lower rank, class, or position within structured system
examples: The subordination of personal interests benefits team success
Grammatical subordination creates complex sentence structures effectively

definitions: written legal order requiring person to appear in court or produce documents
examples: The witness received a subpoena requiring testimony next week
Ignoring a federal subpoena can result in contempt charges

definitions: distinct group within larger population sharing specific characteristics or geographic location
examples: The study examined diabetes rates in elderly subpopulations
Genetic subpopulations show unique evolutionary adaptation patterns

definitions: self-contained sequence of program instructions performing specific task called from main program
examples: The sorting subroutine processes array elements efficiently
Debugging revealed errors in the calculation subroutine code

definitions: person who pays to receive regular service, publication, or access to content
examples: The magazine lost thousands of subscribers last quarter
Netflix subscribers can access exclusive streaming content worldwide

definitions: character or symbol written or printed below the normal line of text
examples: Chemical formulas use subscripts to indicate atom numbers
The subscript notation Hâ‚‚O represents two hydrogen atoms

definitions: arrangement to receive regular access to service, publication, or content through periodic payment
examples: The annual subscription includes digital and print editions
Streaming subscription services transformed entertainment consumption patterns

definitions: subdivision of section within larger document, chapter, or legal statute
examples: Subsection 3.2 details the experimental methodology thoroughly
The contract subsection addresses payment terms specifically

definitions: sequence that can be derived from another sequence by deleting elements without changing order
examples: The mathematical subsequence maintains original element ordering
Finding longest common subsequence helps compare DNA sequences

definitions: state of being excessively willing to obey others without question or resistance
examples: His subservience to management undermined team morale
Breaking free from subservience requires developing self-confidence

definitions: set whose members are all contained within another larger set
examples: Integers form a subset of all real numbers
The research focused on a subset of participants

definitions: gradual sinking or settling of ground surface due to underground material movement
examples: Mining operations caused severe land subsidence problems
The building showed cracks from differential subsidence patterns

definitions: company controlled by another company through majority ownership of voting stock
examples: The tech giant acquired three subsidiaries last year
Their European subsidiary handles all regional operations

definitions: sum of money granted by government or public body to help industry or business
examples: Agricultural subsidies support farmers during crop failures
The housing subsidy program assists low-income families

definitions: minimum resources, especially food and shelter, necessary to support life
examples: Many families struggle at subsistence level income
Subsistence farming provides just enough food for survival

definitions: layer of soil lying immediately beneath surface soil containing less organic matter
examples: The clay subsoil prevented proper drainage after storms
Construction requires testing subsoil stability before building

definitions: subset of vector space that is itself a vector space under same operations
examples: Linear algebra students studied three-dimensional subspace properties
The null subspace contains all vectors mapped to zero

definitions: taxonomic category ranking below species, usually geographically isolated population with distinct characteristics
examples: The island subspecies evolved unique coloration patterns
Scientists identified three subspecies of mountain lions

definitions: particular kind of matter with uniform properties throughout its composition
essential nature, meaning, or importance of something rather than its form
examples: Unknown substances require careful laboratory analysis procedures
The controlled substance regulations restrict certain medications
The speech had little substance beyond rhetoric
Critics argued the proposal lacked substance and detail

definitions: facility in electrical generation, transmission, and distribution system where voltage is transformed
examples: The power substation serves three neighboring communities
Lightning struck the electrical substation causing widespread outages

definitions: person or thing acting or serving in place of another temporarily or permanently
examples: The substitute teacher managed the class effectively today
Honey serves as a healthier sugar substitute option

definitions: act of replacing one thing or person with another in specific role or function
examples: Substituting butter with oil changes the texture significantly
The coach kept substituting players throughout the game

definitions: action of replacing someone or something with another person or thing
examples: The recipe allows substitution of ingredients when necessary
Player substitution rules vary between different sports leagues

definitions: underlying substance or layer on which organism grows or is attached
substance on which enzyme acts in biochemical reaction
examples: The coral requires specific substrate for proper growth
Silicon substrate forms the foundation of computer chips
The enzyme binds to its substrate forming a complex
Substrate concentration affects reaction rate significantly

definitions: underlying layer or substance forming foundation or basis of something
examples: The linguistic substratum reveals ancient language influences
Rock substratum determines soil composition above it

definitions: underlying or supporting structure forming foundation of building or system
examples: Engineers reinforced the bridge substructure against earthquakes
The theoretical substructure supports the entire argument

definitions: self-contained system within larger system performing specific function
examples: The cooling subsystem prevents engine overheating effectively
Each subsystem operates independently but coordinates actions

definitions: deceit used to achieve one's goal through evasion or concealment of true intentions
examples: Political subterfuge obscured the real policy intentions
She saw through his subterfuge and confronted him

definitions: secondary or explanatory title following main title of written work
captions displayed at screen bottom translating or transcribing dialogue
examples: The book's subtitle explains its theoretical framework
The article subtitle clarifies the main argument's scope
Foreign films need accurate subtitles for wider audiences
Streaming platforms offer subtitles in multiple languages

definitions: quality of being delicate, elusive, or difficult to detect or analyze precisely
examples: The argument's subtlety required careful philosophical analysis
Wine tasting involves appreciating flavor subtleties

definitions: mathematical operation of removing one quantity from another to find difference
examples: Children learn subtraction after mastering addition concepts
The subtraction of expenses from revenue determines profit

definitions: distinct component part of larger molecular structure or organizational unit
examples: Protein subunits combine forming complex molecular structures
Each military subunit operates under battalion command

definitions: residential area on the outskirts of city or large town
examples: The quiet suburb offered excellent schools and parks
Many families moved from downtown to the suburbs

definitions: suburbs collectively, especially when regarded as characteristic cultural or social environment
examples: Critics argue suburbia promotes isolation and conformity
American suburbia expanded rapidly after World War Two

definitions: systematic attempt to overthrow or undermine government or political system by persons working within
examples: Intelligence agencies investigated suspected acts of subversion
Cultural subversion challenges dominant social narratives effectively

definitions: person seeking to subvert established system or institution, especially government
examples: Authorities arrested suspected subversives during political unrest
The artist was labeled a subversive by conservatives

definitions: underground railway system in city for public transportation
underground passage for pedestrians to cross beneath road or railway
examples: The New York subway carries millions of passengers daily
Taking the subway avoids heavy traffic congestion
Pedestrians use the subway to safely cross the highway
The subway connects both sides of the station

definitions: loudspeaker component designed to reproduce lowest audio frequencies, typically below 200 Hz
examples: The subwoofer adds deep bass to home theater systems
Adjusting subwoofer placement improves room acoustics significantly

definitions: number of people or things following one after another in time or order
process by which someone inherits title, office, or property from predecessor
examples: A succession of storms battered the coastal region
The ecological succession transformed bare rock into forest
The royal succession follows strict hereditary rules
Corporate succession planning ensures leadership continuity
